description: From Latin haurientem, the present participle of hauriēns (“drawing (water, etc.); draining”), the present participle of hauriō (“to draw (water, etc.); to drain”), from Proto-Indo-European *h₂ews- (“dawn; east”).

entries.meaning: (heraldry) Of a fish, etc.: in a vertical orientation, with its head up (to chief) and tail down (to base).
